Ad Text:
We’re on the lookout for a number of Embedded Systems Engineers to join a product development team in Sydney. Reporting to the Systems Engineering Manager, these roles offer the opportunity to make a direct impact in a niche, fast-growing defence technology sector.
  
You’ll be at the heart of developing current and next-generation products, bridging the gap between stakeholder needs and engineering outcomes. This means gathering, analysing, and managing requirements, ensuring complex systems come together seamlessly, and empowering development teams to work towards common goals. If you thrive on autonomy, responsibility, and collaboration, this role is for you.
  
What you’ll do

Work with a team of systems engineers across sensors & effectors and product development to define and deliver new capabilities.
Develop and embed systems engineering processes that promote best practice, efficiency, and quality.
Manage documentation of system design, requirements, and test strategies, with a strong focus on integration testing.
Act as the bridge between stakeholders and engineering teams, communicating risks, issues, and progress.
Own technical problems, coordinate cross-functional solutions, and drive continual product improvement.
Partner with Product and Project Management to align deliverables and milestones.
Bring the customer’s voice into development teams, ensuring new features meet real-world needs.
What you’ll bring

Bachelor’s or Master’s in Systems, Mechatronics, Electrical, Mechanical, Computer Science, or similar.
3+ years’ experience in systems engineering within complex product development.
Strong grasp of systems engineering frameworks, tools, and lifecycle principles.
Experience with requirements management for hardware/software systems.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively, taking ownership of deliverables.
Desirable: experience with AI-enabled systems, RF hardware/software, electronic warfare, or distributed systems.
Bonus: exposure to cybersecurity in systems engineering, Atlassian tools (Jira/Confluence).
A drive to excel in a high-empowerment, fast-paced, mission-driven environment.
Bonus Points For

Exposure to electronic warfare, artificial intelligence, or machine learning domains.
Experience conducting product demonstrations, gathering end-user feedback, or supporting external product events.
This is a fantastic opportunity for systems-minded engineers ready to take on a diverse, high-impact role within a company at the forefront of counter-threat and autonomous system technologies.

For more info you can contact me at farid@thedrivegroup.com.au or click Apply and send through your details and I'll be in touch!

We’re looking for a talented and driven Embedded Software Engineer to help build, scale, and support complex sensor systems operating in real-world environments. In this role, you’ll design and implement embedded software that runs on Linux-based systems, contributing to projects that push the boundaries of real-time data processing, RF signal detection, and automated response.
  
You’ll work closely with teams spanning AI/ML, data science, hardware engineering, and cloud infrastructure to create robust solutions capable of handling mission-critical workloads. The software you build will directly support applications in security, defence, and remote surveillance.

What You’ll Be Doing

Develop and maintain embedded software features on Linux-based edge systems
Collaborate across disciplines to meet operational and performance requirements
Ensure code is designed for resource-constrained, high-uptime environments
Implement features using modern C++ and Python, depending on project needs
Participate in software design discussions, code reviews, and performance tuning
Work on inter-process communication mechanisms for modular, scalable architectures
Create and maintain high-quality technical documentation for implemented components
Contribute to the continuous integration pipeline and system testing frameworks
Support system monitoring, logging, and observability in production deployments
Engage with DevOps and infrastructure specialists to improve deployment workflows
Your Background

Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field
Proven experience developing applications in modern C++ 
Strong understanding of Linux development (embedded Linux preferred)
Familiarity with multi-process systems and IPC mechanisms
Exposure to Docker, Git, CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitLab), and versioning tools
Experience with design patterns, testing, and scalable software architecture
Bonus Points For

Knowledge of concurrency, performance optimisation, or low-latency systems
Hands-on experience with Go programming
Background in machine learning, RF signal processing, or DSP
Exposure to FPGA, sensor integration, or systems running in remote deployments
Understanding of DevOps practices, including observability and automated deployments
Interested candidates should click Apply and send through their details, or you can email me at farid@thedrivegroup.com.au for more info or call me on 0435777965!

A new opportunity is open for a Senior Algorithm Engineer to join a high-performance development team working on real-time RF and AI-based sensing systems. This role is ideal for an experienced engineer who enjoys turning advanced theory into practical solutions that operate at the edge.
  
The role involves designing, integrating, and optimising complex algorithms to power intelligent sensor platforms deployed in operational environments. It requires deep collaboration with software engineers, systems designers, and UI developers to ensure algorithmic outputs are both efficient and actionable.

Key Responsibilities

Research and implement mathematical models and algorithms for deployment on edge computing platforms
Collaborate with software teams to optimise model integration within production architectures
Contribute to GUI discussions to ensure algorithmic outputs are user-friendly and visually intuitive
Manage data pipelines including multi-domain datasets, preparation, labelling, and validation
Maintain clean, well-documented codebases for sensor fusion and ML-driven software modules
Support decision-making across software and hardware teams for complex system evolution
Guide the integration of models into scalable, high-performance production environments
Skills and Experience Required

Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related technical field
Proven experience designing and integrating complex algorithms for sensor data or real-time systems
Familiarity with signal processing, time-series analysis, and sensor fusion techniques
Experience working with RF data or analysis tools is highly desirable
Strong grasp of probability, statistics, and their application in modelling
Competency with version control and Git workflows
Comfortable operating in Linux environments with modern toolchains
Desirable Attributes

Exposure to ML/AI workflows or model deployment practices
Familiarity with heterogeneous computing or GPU programming (CUDA)
Ability to turn business requirements into robust, interpretable algorithmic solutions
Strong communicator capable of bridging technical conversations across multidisciplinary teams
Passion for staying up to date with algorithmic advances and deploying real-world solutions
A hands-on mindset and motivation to contribute in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment
This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of advanced analytics, signal intelligence, and real-time systems, with tangible impact across defence, surveillance, and security domains.

For more info, feel free to contact me at farid@thedrivegroup.com.au or click Apply to send through your details and I'll be in touch.

About Us

AUTONOMA specialises in process automation across physical and digital environments, using advanced AI and industrial automation technologies to solve the dull, dirty, dangerous, and difficult tasks in industry.

We design and deliver reliable, industrial‑grade automation solutions for challenging environments. Our work spans robotics, control systems, software automation, and bespoke engineering solutions for clients across Australia.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Graduate Automation Engineer who is excited to build a career in industrial automation and develop deep expertise in Industrial Automation and Robotics.

This role is ideal for someone who is hands‑on, curious, and keen to learn how real‑world control systems are designed, built, programmed, and commissioned. You’ll be supported by senior engineers while contributing to live client projects.

What You Will Do

You’ll work alongside experienced engineers to:

Assist with designing and programming Siemens PLC and HMI systems

Support development and testing using TIA Portal and WinCC

Learn, program and commission Industrial Robotic Systems

Participate in on-site commissioning and system upgrades

Help troubleshoot control system and electrical faults

Collaborate with clients, electricians, and project teams

Contribute to technical documentation and system deliverables

About You

You are a recent graduate who wants genuine hands-on experience with industrial control systems.

Required:

Degree in Electrical, Mechatronics, Automation, or similar

Understanding of PLC programming concepts (Siemens preferred)

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Willingness to work on-site around industrial equipment

Good communication and teamwork skills

Australian work rights and valid driver’s licence

Nice to Have (but not required):

Exposure to Siemens TIA Portal, WinCC, or PLC hardware

Understanding of Profinet/Profibus

Internship or project experience in control systems or automation

Interest in robotics, SCADA, lab automation, or functional safety

Travel Requirements

Occasional travel to client sites (metro and regional)

Some short‑notice travel depending on project needs

All required training and supervision provided

What We Offer

Competitive graduate salary

Real hands-on experience with industrial automation projects

Mentoring from senior automation engineers

A collaborative and technically focused team environment

How to Apply

If you’re passionate about automation and want to begin your engineering career working on real industrial systems, we’d love to hear from you.
